This chart plots the 7 day moving average of a companyâ€™s Controversy Ratio aggregated over all 3 E|S|G axes (covering all 5 SASB ESG Topics). The average controversy ratio over the entire period is then displayed as a number in \[%]. **The higher the %, the higher the controversy risk score.**

*A controversy is a negative news document with a sentiment score below -70%.*

Looking at this chart you can easily assess the relative amount of bad press a company has received over the entire period and see whether the situation is improving or getting worse.

***In total, 4 criticality levels can be defined:***

* Level 1: no risk when score is between 0-10% 
* Level 2: low risk when score is between 10-25%
* Level 3: medium risk when score is between 25-35%
* Level 4: high risk when score is between 35-100%
